headline: BofA Says Nvidia Volatility May Persist Ahead of U.S. Export Rule Implementation
summary: Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) shares may remain volatile until mid-May as investors await clarity on the U.S. government's planned export controls on artificial intelligence semiconductors, according to Bank of America.  In a recent report, Bank of America analyst Vivek Arya said the volatility may last until May 15, when the United States plans to apply the "AI Diffusion Rule" of the Biden administration.  Arya called the day "Liberation Day," implying it may be a turning point in how Nvidia's China-related concerns are seen by markets.Through its H20 graphics processing chips, or GPUs, Arya said Nvidia had around 10% direct income exposure to China, which the suggested legislation might influence.

raw.headline: BofA Says Nvidia Volatility May Persist Ahead of U.S. Export Rule Implementation
raw.summary: Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) shares may remain volatile until mid-May as investors await clarity on the U.S. government's planned export controls on artificial intelligence semiconductors, according to Bank of America.  In a recent report, Bank of America analyst Vivek Arya said the volatility may last until May 15, when the United States plans to apply the "AI Diffusion Rule" of the Biden administration.  Arya called the day "Liberation Day," implying it may be a turning point in how Nvidia's China-related concerns are seen by markets.Through its H20 graphics processing chips, or GPUs, Arya said Nvidia had around 10% direct income exposure to China, which the suggested legislation might influence.

Robinhood (HOOD) introduces new banking services and wealth management services for customers. 23andMe (ME) skyrockets after receiving approval to sell customer data in its bankruptcy proceedings. headline: Here are the chips that Nvidia can sell to China
summary: After the U.S. placed chip-export controls on China in October 2022 to curb the country’s technological advances, U.S.-based chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) designed less-powerful versions of its artificial intelligence chips to continue its presence in the Chinese market while complying with the rules.

headline: Nvidia Falls As Trump Tariffs Spook AI Chip Leader; Is Nvidia A Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia dropped nearly 6% on Wednesday and fell another 2% early Thursday amid news of the Trump administration's latest move to curb certain chip exports.  Is Nvidia stock a sell now?  On Monday shares rose amid news that tariffs on the semiconductor sector may not land on April 2 — the day the President Donald Trump was scheduled to announce reciprocal duties on imported goods.

headline: Nvidia-backed CoreWeave plans to downsize US IPO, source says
summary: (Reuters) -CoreWeave plans to reduce the size of its U.S. initial public offering and price the shares below range, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.  The Nvidia-backed cloud services provider is now looking to sell 37.5 million shares and price them below the range at $40 apiece, the source added, requesting anonymity discussing confidential information.  The listing is being closely watched as a test for the fragile U.S. IPO market and a gauge of whether investor enthusiasm for AI newcomers remains strong or is waning.

The Nvidia-backed cloud services provider is now looking to sell 37.5 million shares and price them below the range at $40 apiece, the source added, requesting anonymity discussing confidential information.  The listing is being closely watched as a test for the fragile U.S. IPO market and a gauge of whether investor enthusiasm for AI newcomers remains strong or is waning.

headline: Nvidia Falls as AI Optimism Cools and Technical Signals Weaken
summary: Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) dropped 5.7% on Wednesday to close at $113.76, leading a broader selloff in technology stocks as traders reacted to weakening sentiment around artificial intelligence and bearish technical signals.  As investors prepared for any fresh tariff declarations from former President Donald Trump, the drop corresponded with losses in other significant tech firms like Meta Platforms (META, Financials), Amazon (AMZN, Financials), Alphabet (GOOG, Financials), and Tesla (TSLA, Financials).Describing Nvidia as the "linchpin" of the tech industry, Jim Cramer, head of CNBC's "Mad Money," suggested Wednesday the selloff might grow.

raw.headline: Nvidia Falls as AI Optimism Cools and Technical Signals Weaken
raw.summary: Nvidia (NVDA, Financials) dropped 5.7% on Wednesday to close at $113.76, leading a broader selloff in technology stocks as traders reacted to weakening sentiment around artificial intelligence and bearish technical signals.  As investors prepared for any fresh tariff declarations from former President Donald Trump, the drop corresponded with losses in other significant tech firms like Meta Platforms (META, Financials), Amazon (AMZN, Financials), Alphabet (GOOG, Financials), and Tesla (TSLA, Financials).Describing Nvidia as the "linchpin" of the tech industry, Jim Cramer, head of CNBC's "Mad Money," suggested Wednesday the selloff might grow.

headline: Intel Stock Could Soar If This Nvidia Rumor Is True
summary: One of the key priorities for new Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) CEO Lip-Bu Tan is to turn the company's foundry business into a success.  The Intel 18A process node, which features multiple technological innovations and should challenge market leader TSMC in terms of performance and efficiency, is ready for production.  According to UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri, Intel is closing in on scoring Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) as a foundry customer.

raw.headline: Intel Stock Could Soar If This Nvidia Rumor Is True

According to UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri, Intel is closing in on scoring Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) as a foundry customer.

headline: 3 Cheap Tech Stocks to Buy Right Now
summary: While the broader stock market has bounced back somewhat following its recent sell-off, many tech stocks are still well off their highs and trading at cheap valuations.  Trading down almost 23% from its highs, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) is an attractively valued growth stock.  The company has been able to more than double its revenue each of the past two years, while analysts expect the company's revenue to increase by more than 50% this year.

headline: Exclusive: China's H3C warns of Nvidia AI chip shortage amid surging demand
summary: One of China’s largest server makers, H3C, has flagged potential shortages of Nvidia's H20 chip, the most advanced AI processor legally available domestically under U.S. export controls, in a client notice seen by Reuters.  The potential supply crunch could create obstacles for China's artificial intelligence ambitions at a time when its tech firms are aggressively expanding their investments in AI.  "H20's international supply chain faces significant uncertainties," the company said in Tuesday's notice, adding that current inventory was nearly depleted.

raw.headline: Exclusive: China's H3C warns of Nvidia AI chip shortage amid surging demand
raw.summary: One of China’s largest server makers, H3C, has flagged potential shortages of Nvidia's H20 chip, the most advanced AI processor legally available domestically under U.S. export controls, in a client notice seen by Reuters.  The potential supply crunch could create obstacles for China's artificial intelligence ambitions at a time when its tech firms are aggressively expanding their investments in AI.  "H20's international supply chain faces significant uncertainties," the company said in Tuesday's notice, adding that current inventory was nearly depleted.

headline: Stock Market Sell-Off: 2 AI Stocks to Buy Now and Hold for 20 Years
summary: Here are two AI stocks caught up in the broader market volatility worth buying today because they could be rewarding over the long term.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) is a no-brainer investment.  It has been on the cutting edge of graphics processing unit (GPU) technology for a long time, and today, it controls a high percentage of the GPU market for data centers, where those chips provide the parallel processing muscle needed to train and power AI.

headline: Xiaomi Stock and the Rest of China’s ‘Terrific 10’ Are the Tech Bet for 2025
summary: Nvidia Tesla  and the rest of Big Tech are having a rough go of it, while China’s Terrific 10—  Alibaba Tencent Meituan Xiaomi JD.com NetEase Baidu BYD Geely  and  SMIC  —are not.  The answer, according to YT Boon, Neuberger Berman’s head of thematic for Asia, is a resounding yes.  For starters, the emergence of cheaper artificial intelligence technology developed by Chinese company DeepSeek may have kick-started a new wave of investment in AI in China—and that should benefit leading Chinese companies.
